st:Description.name: Knowledge
st:Description.st:detailedRole: Enable the user to deal with these categories of options: Parameter Tree View, Parameter names, Relations update in part context and Design Tables

st:attribute.Name: ParametersViewWithValue
st:attribute.st:role: Displays the parameter values in the specification tree
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Displays the parameter values in the specification tree

st:attribute.Name: ParametersViewWithFormula
st:attribute.st:role: Displays the formulas constraining the parameter in the specification tree
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Displays the formulas constraining the parameter in the specification tree

st:attribute.Name: EncadrementPathnames
st:attribute.st:role: Defines if parameter names should be surrounded by the symbol `
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This option should be set to true if you work with non-Latin characters. If this option is set to false, parameter names should have to be renamed in Latin characters when used in formulas

st:attribute.Name: RelationSynchronousAtCreation
st:attribute.st:role: Enables the user to create synchronous relations
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Enables the user to create synchronous relations: when creating the relation, it defines if the relation will be synchronous (i.e. the evaluation will be launched as soon as one of its parameters is modified) or asynchronous (i.e. the evaluation will be launched when the Part is updated)

st:attribute.Name: RelationIntegratedToUpdate
st:attribute.st:role: Enables the user to associate the evaluation of asynchronous relations with the global update
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Enables the user to associate the evaluation of asynchronous relations with the global update

st:attribute.Name: RelationIntegratedToUpdateNoQuestion
st:attribute.st:role: Enables the user to get rid off the confirmation warning when the global update mode is selected
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Enables the user to get rid off the confirmation warning when the global update mode is selected

st:attribute.Name: DesignTableSynchroMode
st:attribute.st:role: Defines the type of synchronisation for Design Tables
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Enables the user to define the type of synchronisation for Design Tables: Automatic at load, Interactive at load or Manual

st:attribute.Name: DesignTableDefaultCopyMode
st:attribute.st:role: Defines the defaut mode for copying data in model
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Enables the user to define the defaut mode: to copy data contained in the external source file into the model or not: true means the data will be copied

st:attribute.Name: DesignTableRepRef
st:attribute.st:role: Defines the defaut mode for rep ref usage in Design Table creation
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Enables the user to define rep ref usage in Design Table creation: true means that the rep ref are retrieved in PLM Chooser during design table creation, false means that plm documents are used

st:attribute.Name: EditSpreadsheetExtApp
st:attribute.st:role: Selects the input directory to External Application
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Enables the user to select path of external application to launch for editing spreadsheet documents

st:attribute.Name: DesignTableTabulatedFileExt
st:attribute.st:role: Defines the type of tabulated text file format for creation of Design Table
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Enables the user to set the tabulated text file format for creation of Design Table/Product Table, if user chooses not to create spreadsheet : Text file or CSV file

st:attribute.Name: ScriptExecutionAtLoadSetting
st:attribute.st:role: Defines the way user want to manage script security

st:enum.st:role: Ask First Time On Each Script Execution

st:attribute.Name: PublishedParametersExportPreference
st:attribute.st:role: Allows to export or not the published parameters of instantiated user features
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Allows to export or not the published parameters of instantiated user features: false means no possible export

st:attribute.Name: ExcelLibPrefAtLoadSetting
st:attribute.st:role: Defines the Excel read/write Library user wants to use.
